required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assess the Safety and Efficacy of Individually Tailored Prophylaxis With Human-cl rhFVIII in Patients With Severe Haemophilia A
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Open-label, Multicenter Phase 3b Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of Individually Tailored Prophylaxis With Human-cl rhFVIII in Previously Treated Adult Patients With Severe Haemophilia A

oversight_info.authority: Czech Republic: State Institute for Drug Control
Poland: Office for Registration of medicinal products
Slovakia: State Institute for Drug Control
Spain:Spanish Agency for Medicine and Health products
United Kingdom: Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the number of breakthrough bleeds under tailored prophylaxis with human cell line recombinant factor FVIII (Human-cl rhFVIII) with the historical bleeding rate from patients who received Human-cl rhFVIII as on demand treatment.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.description: Reduction of the annualized total bleeding rate observed in the GENA-01 study (58.1 total bleeding episodes per patient per year) by 50% during individually tailored prophylaxis

secondary_outcome.description: Reduction of the annualized spontaneous bleeding rate observed in the GENA-01 study (38.5 spontaneous bleeding episodes per patient per year) by 50% during individually tailored prophylaxis
Reduction of annualized bleeding rate observed in the GENA-01 study by 50% in patients with 2x/week prophylaxis or less

other_outcome.measure: Assess thrombin generation assay in terms of usefulness in individualized therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Severe Haemophilia A (FVIII:C <1%) according to medical history
- Male patients >= 18 year Previous treatment with a FVIII concentrate (regular prophylaxis with good compliance or on-demand treatment) for at least 150 Exposure Days (EDs)
- Good documentation regarding dosing and bleeding frequency in the 6 months preceding study start
- Immunocompetence (CD4+ count > 200/microliter)
- HIV-negative, if positive, viral load <200 particles/microliter or < 400,000 copies/mL
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any coagulation disorder other than Haemophilia A
- Present or past FVIII inhibitor activity (> 0.6 BU)
- Severe liver or kidney disease

facility.name: University Multiprofile Hospital for Active Treatment
University of Debrecen, Medical and Health Science Center
Louis Turcanu Emergency Clinical Children's Hospital
